summary: The World Bank lends money to low-and middle-income countries for infrastructure, social, and economic development. It assesses risks and oversees borrowers who award contracts and manage the projects. U.S. businesses can compete for contracts, but nearly half of the 15 we spoke to raised concerns about process integrity and transparency. Over half said they may not bid on future contracts based on their prior experiences...
title: World Bank Procurement: Risk Monitoring Can be Enhanced as U.S. Businesses Face Challenges Competing
